book.title: The Sin Trilogy Bundle: A Necessary Sin, The Next Sin, One Last Sin

review.body:
Definitely one to read!

Will keep you captivated The whole series! Couldn't put it down, love the characters and their story lines! Very hot and very steamy also, but with class!

I guess a 3.5. There were moments of pure 5 and moments of a 2. Overall it was a good book putting this author on the radar for me. I would definitely read more of her work. So why a 3.5? Because Aspen was too good for her father and as strong as she is portrayed she continued to let her father v...

book.title: Black as Night (A Fairy Tale Retold #2)

review.body: Doman references Christian symbolism in her modern version of Snow White. She also references Alice's adventures through the looking glass.

book.title: The Lightning Thief (Percy Jackson and the Olympians, #1)

review.body: I read an advanced copy that I found at the San Bernardino City library. I liked the concept and the use of Greek mythology.
A fun, quick read. Looking forward to volume 2.

book.title: Did I Mention I Need You? (The DIMILY Trilogy, #2)

review.body:
Well, having read the first book in this series, ‘Did I Mention I Love You?’, I was hoping that Eden’s two timing, cheating ways would be a thing of the past. Unfortunately, this isn’t the case and continue unabated in this second story in the trilogy.

The setting of New York City is explored bril...

A beautiful story. This is storytelling like it should be, vivid imagery, wonderful illustrations, and a story that fills your heart and your imagination as you read it. I totally fell in love with it.
best thriller I think I ever read and I have read many. Lots of interesting twists and turns tha tyou were not suspecting. Be prepared for graphic violence though.

book.title: Bastard's Baby: A Bad Boy Secret Baby Romance

review.body: I was given an ARC for an honest review. B. B. Hamel keeps getting better and better. This book captured and held on to me till the end. Everything flowed so smoothly from the war between the Russian and Italian mobs to Vince and Kaley. It was the perfect balance and of course the sex was raw and...

Narrated by Mira, Harrison blends together: "Snow White" and "Beauty and the Beast" to create a unique fairytale that deals with the contentious relationship between sisters.
The theme also addresses forgiveness and the power of love over magic.

book.title: Green Lantern: The Sinestro Corps War

review.body: This story is massive, galaxy spanning, and full of character moments and progression from the main cast as well as those around them. Most of the art is great, and as is always the case with Johns and Johns-related material, the dialog is possibly the highlight of the whole thing. That being sai...
Loved this cute story!!!! The love they have for each other is so sweet. One part had me laughing out loud but I won't spoil anything for anyone. Def. worth the read!
I had somehow missed the entire "war brides" part of history and it is fascinating.

book.title: The Crown and the Arrow (The Wrath and the Dawn, #0.5)

review.body:
I Read This as a Prequel

I haven't yet read The Wrath & the Dawn. In fact, I've struggled with it, and I have put it down numerous times. I thought that reading this short story would pique my interest, and it has. I'm now curious to finish the novel.
Fun story, artwork is amazing, I'm really digging this "new" Hulk who is constantly learning more about himself and his powers. Can't wait to see what happens in the next arc!
I read this in Tamil. I still remember few events in the book. A warm afterglow remains after all these years.

I loved this book but some how could not connect with it - They had took a true story and changed and twisted it. Usualy I like this but I don't know, it just felt a bit wrong. However, the actual book is amazing, and a very descriptive and truthful account of the holocaust and concentration camp...

Nice to return to Grisham now and again to read a thriller that's not constantly kickin' ass and spewing guts all over the sidewalk. The last third of the book is a bit anti-climatic and the biggest surprise is what didn't happen. Hah! no spoiler for you.
